website_summaries.verdict: This colorful, engaging workbook focuses mostly on the United States but offers a sampling of world geography, too.
pros: Includes U.S. and global geography as well as grid maps, topography, famous landmarks, and more
Includes crosswords, games, and other learning tools
Complexity builds as the book progresses
cons: Appeals more to the younger end of the recommended grade spectrum

customer_reviews.title: This is a Winner 🏆
customer_reviews.text: I skimmed through this book and I must say I made a good decision in purchasing this for my sons. I purchased two. I am homeschooling them so this is a great add on to their education. This book touches on the topics mentioned in the description and more. Very thick book too as you can see in pictures I posted. I chose the updated version yet I can not tell you the difference btwn the old that is selling for a dollar less. This is a winner though😁. Hope my review was helpful in your purchasing decision.
customer_reviews.author: Ms B

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not complete...unless someone thinks that: USA = the World
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice workbook. On the other hand, it states to be complete. It might be complete with regards to USA, but not with regards to the rest of the world, so we will not be using it as much as we intended it when we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat surprising
customer_reviews.text: My initial fears were mostly about how the workbook is for grades 3-6 and upon arrival, my anxiety spiked a bit more. The grades aren't clearly labeled so you have no real way of knowing which pages are supposed to be for which grade, which makes tracking progress a little difficult. That being said the workbook is very well set up. It's thorough, easy to read and engaging. My son has no issues completing his work alongside our massive wall map, even asking if he can do a few pages on his own.
customer_reviews.author: Niki McAlister

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful subject!
customer_reviews.text: Geography is one of the subjects i was excited to teach to my 7 year old. We've been doing this book together, even though the grade level is 3-6th. She has not had difficulty with it. Once we are finished, i may re-buy it just because it is such a great book.
customer_reviews.author: hollie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old LOVES this book. The intro might seem slightly elementary for that age, but you can always skip ahead some. Makes geography fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this for a homeschool tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this workbook after checking it out at the library. I like all the activities and the progression of difficulty. I use this for my son for homeschool activities. It’s bright and colorful with a variety of activities.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Tons of activities to keep my 8-year-old occupied. Some of the activities are too advanced for her at age 8, but she will be able to do them in a year or two. But this book is so huge, it'll take her a couple years to get through it, so she can do those harder activities as she grows. she just works on it about once a week.
customer_reviews.author: elsa Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: This is a great resource!
customer_reviews.text: This book is thicker than I expected! It covers a wide variety of maps and geography exercises. It’s also not just filling in blanks. There are coloring opportunities, cut & paste activities, and even two pages that you use to paste together a map of the United States. Any elementary kid would have fun with this and get a lot of practice with maps and learning geography.
customer_reviews.author: username89

customer_reviews.title: Great for Homeschool
customer_reviews.text: I am homeschooling my 3rd and 4th graders and this is their geography workbook. I also bought them a globe and atlases to supplement this. They enjoy this workbook so much (we try to do at least 3 pages a day) that when we are done for the day, they are begging for more work! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Lots

customer_reviews.title: Excellent progression From simple to more complex map skill and geography!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this book! I am teacher by training but Homeschooling my fourth grader right now and this book is excellent! While it has a few super easy pages it progresses through topics very nicely building and growing in complexity. It uses states and countries to teach map skills and moves into geography . I think it has an abundance of excellent activities to make learning map skills and geography fun and interesting! So happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: michkruz

customer_reviews.title: Good for ages 7-10.
customer_reviews.text: Good for 7 year old and my 9 years old. The beginning starts at a basic level and advances. Starts with basic map reading skills and progresses to facts about the entire US. I have bought 2 more books for my 9 and 10 year old. I will use this over a few years for my 7 year old.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mitra

customer_reviews.title: Great learning workbook!
customer_reviews.text: Very thick workbook with easy to follow directions. My 6 year old really enjoys this! He’s very curious about the world continents and USA states. It also has some learning about compasses,!which was the first page he wanted to do because he was so curious about how they work.
customer_reviews.author: Corrina

customer_reviews.title: Good for US Geography
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for US Geography, this is great. Its world geography section is ok, but not very detailed. I have not used the map skills section, but I teach 5th grade and its a bit below my students' skill and ability level.
customer_reviews.author: sarahwb

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Geography was not a strong subject of mine while in school. I'm so glad that I get to start our kids early. The very first lesson is the most basic of geography one could learn... a bedrooms floor plan! Brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: thegoodsied

customer_reviews.title: Good workbook
customer_reviews.text: My 9 yr old is homeschooled & this is his favorite workbook. He doesn't like doing school work so I give him this on the days I don't feel like fighting.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best workbook ever!
customer_reviews.text: This workbook is high quality! My third grader absolutely loves it. Very detailed, tons of info. Mainly North America/US. Very highly recommended. I will be repurchasing for my two younger children as well.
customer_reviews.author: Crunchycloth

customer_reviews.title: Out of date geographical information
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for the global geography for an oceans unit so imagine my dismay on the outdated section on oceans. It only recognizes the original 4 oceans and not the Southern Ocean that was declared an ocean for 20 years. Very disappointing. I do like the states pages but I don’t know enough about all of the states to determine how valid the information is so I expect to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Fun extra book
customer_reviews.text: My 4th grader loved this book. I bought it to fill in some gaps with his home schooling and he thought I’d bought it for fun. He is just going through it on his own.
customer_reviews.author: B. Emerick

customer_reviews.title: Learn is fun!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves the activities of this book; It is very friendly with learning and fun. I really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Bravo

customer_reviews.title: 6 yo LOVES this book. Homeschool home run!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old LOVES this book! We have fun both doing it together and she enjoys doing the pages independently. A home run for homeschoolers and all around. Thanks to the authors.
customer_reviews.author: Am Prime

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Book
customer_reviews.text: This workbook covers all things Geography grades 3-6. It is a thick book with a lot of engaging activities. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Longer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent geography workbook
customer_reviews.text: My second-grade map lover enjoys this book thoroughly! Of course he will work through it for another couple of years as it has lots of interesting pages from which to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra McCorkle

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for young elementary geography
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite off the shelf workbook I've purchased so far. Tons of information and detail, bright fun colors, and engaging activities for my 3rd grader.
customer_reviews.author: PunkRockDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and as described not a mark in the books! Thank you!

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a semester of homeschooling. It was easy to use for my son and myself.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn & Rodney Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book and it’s huge! Plenty of pages of work and it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my daughter’s homeschooling this year
customer_reviews.author: C. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: fine motor skills and is just overall fun
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son loves map work and geography. This book contains several different types of map work and incorporates critical thinking, sequence, scanning, fine motor skills and is just overall fun. It is full color, the pages are gorgeous. I have recommended it to several other people.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: My homeschooler has really been enjoying this. We love that it shows you how to work the problem before attempting it on your own. The language arts section is great. We paired this with our Sonlight curriculum.

customer_reviews.title: Fun activities
customer_reviews.text: We Home school, So far my son 9 so far loves the workbook and asks to do the activities
customer_reviews.author: Rosario Y Rios

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We loves this book so much for my son, we have purchased it for our younger 2 children as well
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Bottum93

customer_reviews.title: Challenging, interesting, and kid friendly.
customer_reviews.text: The book is very easy to follow along. They give interesting lessons that are challenging but kid friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Misti

customer_reviews.title: Great resource
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this resource. I use this as a teaching tool, independent practice, assignments for a grade and event used parts added to a test.

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a few other books for home summer school to help keep my little ones mind fresh for the upcoming year. It's nice because it includes imagination and art which, at least for my child, was entertaining and made the projects easy to remember and apply in upcoming works in the book. That said, my child wanted to summer school time because it was enjoyable.
